meanings.definition: To touch, hold, or manipulate with the hands.
meanings.sent1: She handled the fragile vase carefully.
meanings.sent2: He handled the tools with ease.
meanings.sent3: The monkey handled the banana like a pro.
meanings.sent4: She handled the situation with kid gloves.
meanings.sent5: He handled the puppy gently, as if it were made of glass.

meanings.definition: To deal with or control a situation or problem.
meanings.sent1: The teacher handled the noisy classroom well.
meanings.sent2: He handled the difficult customer with patience.
meanings.sent3: The detective handled the case with a touch of humor.
meanings.sent4: She handled the crisis like a seasoned pro.
meanings.sent5: He handled the pressure of the game with grace and skill.

meanings.definition: To manage or take care of something.
meanings.sent1: She handled the finances for the family.
meanings.sent3: The robot handled the chores around the house.
meanings.sent4: She handled the garden with love and dedication.
meanings.sent5: He handled the responsibility of the team captain with pride.
